No, we dont support compression for large results. Definitely a good feature to support. When you say large - does it mean 10k, 100k or 1m?
Will these queries have group by or just select + filter. I am thinking if its better for servers to send compressed response to broker and broker simply concatenate them and sends it across.

Adding unit test for realtime segment with/without inverted indexes by using ScanBasedFilterOperator and BitmapBasedFilterOperator.
Also adding unit test for RangePredicate with match and mismatch cases.
Could you please also add unit tests?

I don't see anything major that would prevent merging this, I'd love to give this another review before it gets merged but if I don't have time for it today, merge it so that you don't get blocked :)
Changed config name to enableDefaultColumns; Removed extra parameter from SegmentPreProcessor; Added unit test.
lgtm, aside from the open comments.

@raviarin I think "enableDefaultValueForColumns" is a little bit misleading because people will think it is  to enable default value for existing columns. Also, it is a little bit too long (think of a config string: "pinot.server.instance.enable.default.value.for.columns"). I discussed with Mayank and still cannot get a perfect name. So I plan to just use "enableDefaultColumns" since its the shortest. What do you think?
If no logic change, then LGTM. Please remember to resolve the conflicts.
